text: Andreas Tsoumanis (alternate spelling: Antreas) (; born July 15, 2001) is a Greek professional basketball player for Eleftheroupoli of the Greek 2nd Division, on loan from Olympiacos. He is a 2.03 m (6'8") tall small forward- power forward. ==Professional career== Tsoumanis began his pro career in 2018, during the 2017–18 season, with the Greek Basket League club Olympiacos.ΤΣΟΥΜΑΝΗΣ Αντρέας | STOIXIMAN.GR Basket League 2017–18 . For the 2019–20 season, he was assigned to play in the Greek 2nd Division, with Olympiacos' reserve team, Olympiacos B. On September 6, 2020, Tsoumanis was loaned out to Eleftheroupoli for the 2020–2021 season. ==National team career== Tsoumanis played with the junior national teams of Greece. With Greece's junior national teams, he won a gold medal at the 2017 FIBA U16 European Championship Division B.Greece 7 – Andreas Tsoumanis. He also played at the 2018 FIBA U18 European Championship.Andreas TSOUMANIS POWER FORWARD. ==References== ==External links== *EuroLeague Under-18 Profile *FIBA Profile *Eurobasket.com Profile *Greek Basket League Profile *RealGM.com Profile *DraftExpress.com Profile Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Greek men's basketball players Category:Olympiacos B.C. title: Andreas Tsoumanis
